review_title: Purpose Driven, Meaningful Work, Great Environment!
pros: AAFP fosters an environment of commitment to employee health and wellbeing, professionally, physically and mentally. Exceptional benefits designed to support individual and family needs. Great hybrid work schedule combining remote and onsite, with "work from anywhere" weeks throughout the year! Paid company closure between Christmas holidays and the new year. Welcoming staff, excellent onboarding process, diverse staff representation. Huge gym and access to walking trails. Lots of opportunities for staff gatherings, social and wellness activities. Leadership is listening to and addressing staff concerns and making changes.
cons: Salary increases and bonus potential could be a bit better, but are still very good for a non-profit organization.

job_title: Senior Learning Strategist in Leawood, KS
pros: Great benefits Fantastic retirement company match
cons: Non-inclusive environment. Not receptive to new ideas or new people.

pros: Decent pay, decent benefits. Nice pto schedule.
cons: Does not value employee and subject matter feedback unless it conforms to their political agenda.

job_title: Quality Assurance Analyst in Lenexa, KS
pros: Pay is average, Team members are great
cons: Management is poor, indifference to staffs plight

pros: There are many benefits to working at the AAFP, including the on-site gym, access to the Indian Creek Trail, hybrid work model, the week off between Christmas and New Year, the generous 401K, competitive pay (for new hires), free parking, and proximity to highways, food, and shops.
cons: While the Pros at the AAFP outnumber the Cons, the Cons definitely outweigh the Pros. Across the board, management is toxic and incestuous. The "open door policy" only produces survey after survey with no qualitative improvement. Numerous high-level and ineffective managers have been hired on the basis of past relationships than on their skills and knowledge. It is the default management style of a company to ignore the industry and institutional knowledge of its talented staff. Due to this lack of trust and second-guessing of every decision, the marketing department and the company as a whole are experiencing increased workload, stress, and distrust. It would be remiss of me if I did clarify that the Design and Writing managers have kept their team (and the AAFP) afloat through this adversity. HR is deeply in the pockets of management and refuses to investigate complaints of their unprofessional and bullying behavior, but kowtows to retaliatory managers and fires employees without conducting complete investigations.

pros: Stable organization with great People to work with and for.
cons: Hard to get training or guidance for moving up.

pros: The general employees are great.
cons: Management is over their heads.

pros: Great Benefits Employee Appreciation Reduced hours
cons: Lack of Innovation Lack of upward movement or growth Old guard approach to management

pros: They have decent PTO after you've been there a few years
cons: The leadership keeps claiming the organization is going to "do less better" but for now all that means is that everyone is overworked and burnt out. There is not enough staff and the upper management keeps cutting back on positions, so long hours and weekend work is necessary to stay afloat. They keep talking about a new added benefit of a sabbatical every 5 years, but there is no cross coverage so most people still had to work during their time away. It is a very negative environment and departments do not work well together. Not having a family medicine doctor in a top position has really created a lot of difficulties for the organization. It's not a shock that so many "long-timers" have left the AAFP

pros: The BOD needs to do an in depth review of the c-suite. This company is not what it used to be and it's not just because of the pandemic
cons: Rarely hire for positions from within, outside applicants can negotiate salary but internal applicants can't.

pros: Good PTO accrual, time off from Christmas till New Years. Work/Life balance.
cons:
Job descriptions are normally not what people agreed to and pay is lower then what is normally paid for a position like this. Advancement is very limited. 

Division leadership did not listen to the advise of their people and believe the same old concepts will always work. 

Senior leadership; CEO and COO are completely over their head and do not trust their employees. CEO would rather be back in DC then in KC.

pros: Great coworkers. My direct report manager is talented, listens, and supports our team. The hybrid work model gives some flexibility. The executive management team is aware of recent troubles and taking steps to address the problems. Still a good work-life balance. The work is meaningful. I do believe everyone acts with good intentions. The people are genuinely kind.
cons: Some micromanaging seems to stem from knowledge or experience gaps. Sometimes middle management decisions look like jockeying instead of problem-solving. There are middle and upper management communication weaknesses and shielding the next level up. Some coworkers on other teams do not get the support and mentorship they need to succeed. The company is losing institutional knowledge as people leave.

pros: I couldn't be more happy that I joined this amazing company! The staff are a great group of people to work. AAFP has amazing benefits and compensation - and go the extra mile for things such as staff appreciation week, flexible work schedules, causal dress policy, etc. I am excited to start work each day - and proud to support the AAFP mission.
cons: Hybrid work schedule (3 days in the office). However, AAFP has an amazing on-site gym and plans fun events like food/coffee trucks, company picnic, wellness activities while in the office.

review_title: Out of Touch with Modern Times
pros: Organization is mission driven for family physicians
cons: Senior leadership is out of touch with staff and failing the organization. Too many layers of management which makes competent professionals feel undermined and micromanaged. Work could be done remotely for most roles but leadership insists on a hybrid structure with in person work 3 days a week. Many staff members left the organization after return to office. Leadership is unable to backfill the roles. Younger job candidates seek remote work and the organization is missing out on hiring these people.

job_title: Member Support and Operations Specialist in Leawood, KS
pros: Pay, pay, pay, pay, pay
cons: Horrible management, lack of ability to advance, if you speak up about dissatisfaction you are fired,

review_title: Good benefits, a little erratic at times
pros: Good benefits, ie 401K, health care, vacation
cons: upper management is a little erratic at times

job_title: Human Resources Senior Benefits Representative in Leawood, KS
pros: AAFP tries to maintain a work/life balance for employees
cons: Not offering remote work when feasible

pros: Excellent executive management team; positive work environment; amazing benefits
cons: I have got no complaints.

pros: Good benefits, good location, nice building, great 401k match, nice park across the street
cons: Horrible management with too many middle managers. Incompetent new hires.

pros: Marketing team is awesome. Internal clients sometimes not.
cons: Marketing team often not respected for their expertise.

pros: Nice office in nice area of town
cons: Very rude HR department. Under paid employees

pros: Great company to work for. They take care of their employees and provide excellent benefits.
cons: Lower than expected salary for those that have worked there a long time.

review_title: A great organization and culture to work in
job_title: Chief Information Officer in Leawood, KS
pros: Great Leadership and Great Work Environment
cons: A great place to work; so not many compliants

job_title: Senior Meeting Planner in Leawood, KS
pros: Great benefits & good people.
cons: Roles need to be more defined when working on various projects.

review_title: AAFP is a mission-driven organization that it making an impact for family physicians and their patients.
pros:
The AAFP serves family physicians so they can provide the best care to their patients.  It is a noble mission to support.
The benefits are great and it is very family friendly - the organization recognizes the need to balance work and personal life.
Fellow employees are caring and supportive of each other.
The AAFP is a national leader in the health care field and its expertise is recognized by other medical societies, government officials, and industry leaders.  It makes one proud of the work the organization does.
cons: If you don't like change, it would not be such a comfortable place to work, because the AAFP is changing, as it must, to continue to thrive in a changing environment.

review_title: Good place to work if you drink the Kool-Aid!
pros: Great benefits, nice location, flexible hours, competitive pay, good work/life balance, this sentence is to finish off the rest of the 20 word minimum.
cons: USED to be a great place to work. Most executive level management has flipped in the last 36 months, replacing Directors and VP's who had been here 20+ years each. Lots of talk of culture, but nothing backing it up.  Company has forgotten what it's here to do and has become an organization out to wring the last dime out of every family doctor.  Some positions have no chance of advancement, while some areas promote people once a year (mostly title changes).

pros:
Family friendly
Great benefits (e.g. week between Christmas & New Year's off, employee appreciation week, "gifted" half days off, etc)
Free to find your own way within your job, but guidance when needed
Friendly staff
Feel like you're making a positive impact on family medicine
cons: A lot of employees have spent most (if not all) of their careers here; having not had corporate or other experience, they don't realize how good they've got it.  Their complaints & resistance to change can be frustrating.  I have to say, the grass isn't greener on the other side -- this grass is the greenest I've experienced!

review_title: The members are some of the best people doing the best work for their patients!
pros: The members, Family Physicians, are generally nice and easy to work with. There are a lot of nice perks, i.e. week off between Christmas and New Years, snow days. and onsite work out facility including locker room and showers.
cons: Senior management continues to look for the answer in the "management fad" of the year; there have been several "re-organizations" over the last several years, yet there is not a clear direction of where the organization is headed. As a non-profit, technology tends to be a lower priority, although the situation has improved in the last few years.

pros: They have been able to hire really smart, innovative people. The staff training opportunities are good with a wide variety of offerings.
cons: The lack of strategic direction makes every project a top priority so staff is constantly sidetracked with problems rather than focusing on what will drive membership. I never know what 'marathon' I'll be running each day. There has been no cost of living raise for years, retirement vesting years have increased and the staff are worn out. I predict a mass exdous when the economy strengthens if they don't improve.

review_title: An organization of which I'm proud to be part
pros:
AAFP offers its employees the best of both worlds: a people-focused and mission-based culture of nonprofits and the financial stability and competitive salaries of for-profits.

The company truly invests in its employees and provides opportunities to learn and grow. It also does well recognizing when employees go above and beyond.

Pay and benefits are competitive and have generally improved during my tenure. They also do encourage work-life balance. Sometimes, you'll have to put in extra hours, but that flexibility is reciprocated by the organization.

The people and our members (customers) are good people. I find my fellow employees to be smart, competent, and caring.

There are established cultural values that the company strives towards. While it's always a work in progress, I see genuine attempts at all levels to work towards and adhere to these.
cons:
I think in part due to the longer than average tenure, the organization and its employees are often resistant to change. I've seen this improving lately, but it still has a ways to go.

There can be some drama. I think this stems from people's passion for the job and sometimes aggressive goals set by leadership. It's also exasperated by the third con:

The ratio of idea generators and idea implementors seems to be off. There are a lot of people coming up with great ideas but not enough people able to implement those ideas. This leads to some tension and internal competition for resources.

There's still some "top-down" decision making processes. While most day-to-day decisions are done by collaboration or by employees most familiar with the subject - some large decisions still seem to get made at times without proper feedback from stakeholders.

review_title: Great co-workers, loved the mission to help family physicians nationwide- great work life balance and did a lot of
pros:
37.5 work week, lot of employee activities including annual company picnic and division team buildings events. Dress down Fridays

Great Benefits Package
6% 401k match
Heath insurance 
Dental
Vision
Tuition reimbursement
Opportunity to travel for education
Paid week off between Christmas and New Years
Vacation/ Sick time - accrue 10 days year
cons: Depending on division and management - little room for growth. Divisions tend to be siloed instead of working together on common projects

job_title: Program Specialist/Strategist in Kansas City, KS
pros: Benefits are very good. Excellent 401k match. Good vacation accrual. Several good employee appreciation  activities. Work schedule is good. Tuition reimbursement is helpful
cons:
Company helped advocate for Affordable Care Act and senior management told us our health care benefits would remain the same but our insurance out of pocket amounts are increasing and will continue to do so.
Slow to promote, should provide management training for individuals interested in advancement. Sometimes get caught up in consultants and reorganizing.

pros:
People working at the AAFP really care about the mission of serving the family physician members. It makes all of the work more meaningful even if you are working in an area that does not directly serve the members. 
There is a good work-life balance. The AAFP has been very supportive of staff trying to juggle things during the pandemic.
cons: Nothing that I can think of.

pros: Fair to employees; good mission; respectable benefits and salary is fair especially in not expensive area of the country; good work life balance.
cons: Allow dead wood to be employed too long; some ineffective senior leaders stick around too long; old school time clock mentality in some departments (sticklers about not working at home).

review_title: Great place to work if you have a family
pros: The AAFP has a wonderful work/life balance and really good compensation and benefits. The paid time off between Christmas and New Year's is AWESOME.
cons: Each department feels a bit segregated from each other (we don't get to know other people outside of our immediate area) so that can often feel disconnected. Wish there was a bit more community.

pros: There are some good people who work there and do a good job.
cons: Poor performers are not reprimanded. No recognition or compensation for good work. Management chases after the latest business fad.

pros: There were many pros like a Family atmosphere and work life balance, good benefits, and some interesting travel.
cons: Some of the cons were low salary and some what clickish, other than that it was a great place to work

job_title: Customer Development Specialist in Kansas City, MO
pros: Wonderful to work with physicians and medical residents to provide them with a select group of life and disability insurance products for provide unique protection. Great supervisor, excellent benefits package.
cons: Raises were small, compared to other companies I worked for.

pros: Competitive Pay. Great Culture. Ability to work from home. Good vacation time, including week off during holidays.
cons: Can be difficult to find work/life balance due to work demands.

pros: You know you're working for something that really matters. It makes coming to work a pleasure.
cons: The medical profession's "evidence based" philosophy creates a culture where risk-taking and innovation is difficult.

job_title: Health Education Strategist in Leawood, KS
pros: The staff are friendly, knowledgeable and hard working. The best benefit is paid vacation from Christmas to New Years
cons: Project overload, there are many projects that come up and often it is hard to determine priorities

pros: I worked there for over twenty years and it was for the most part a very good place to work.  But, a few years ago, they brought in a new EVP and another VP who changed the entire concept of what the Academy stands for.
cons: With all their changes, the members are not getting what is deserved to them.

review_title: Environment is like many companies within a company
pros: Great benefits including flex time and wellness programs.
cons: Where you work depends on the extent to which you can partake in the benefits.

pros: The office is closed (with pay) the week between Christmas and New Year.
cons: Company lacks diversity.  Not a lot of upward  mobility.

job_title: Program Manager in Kansas City, MO
pros: Super collegialtiy among the staff team. Great location and place to work.
cons: Senior leadership team lacks women.

review_title: This organization is very unstable due to incompent leadership.
pros: Other employees are kind and caring people
cons: Incompetent leadership claims to have vision, but there is no plan, no direction and changes that are made for the sake of change, not for the best interest of the member.

pros: AAFP cares about their employees and shows it in many ways.
cons: meeting heavy, constantly adding more work without identifying "stop do's".

pros:
Very family-friendly place to work.
Focuses on the needs of is members.
cons: Inconsistent application of policies from department to department.

pros: Week off between Christmas and New Years
cons: Toxic work environment. Many of the reviews on Glassdoor and other websites are by Physician MEMBERS, not employees. The organization is not in good financial shape.
